title: Add drag-and-drop support for file uploads and downloads
description:
Implement drag-and-drop file transfer between the OS file manager (Finder) and Furman's S3 panel. This is table-stakes UX that every major S3 client (Cyberduck, S3 Browser, Transmit, CloudBerry, WinSCP) supports.

## Scope

- Drag from Finder to S3 panel: Upload files/folders to the current S3 prefix
- Drag from S3 panel to Finder: Download files/folders to the drop target
- Drag between panels: If both panels are S3, perform server-side copy; if one is local, upload/download accordingly

## Notes

- Tauri supports drag-and-drop events via the window's onDragDropEvent or HTML5 drag/drop APIs
- Should integrate with the existing transfer queue (multipart, pause/resume, bandwidth throttling)
- Show visual drop target indicator when dragging over a valid panel

title: Add folder sync between local filesystem and S3
description:
Implement local-to-S3 and S3-to-local folder synchronization. This is a heavily requested feature in S3 clients -- Transmit, CloudBerry, and S3 Browser all offer it.

## Scope
- Local to S3 sync: Upload new/changed files from a local directory to an S3 prefix
- S3 to Local sync: Download new/changed objects from an S3 prefix to a local directory
- Comparison modes: Compare by size + last modified date; optionally by ETag/checksum
- Preview mode: Show a diff/plan of what would be transferred before executing
- Filters: Include/exclude patterns (e.g., ignore .DS_Store, node_modules/)
- Delete handling: Option to delete files at destination that don't exist at source (with confirmation)

## Notes
- Should integrate with the existing transfer queue for actual file transfers
- Consider a dry-run mode that shows what would change without transferring
- Bidirectional sync is complex (conflict resolution) -- start with one-directional sync first
- S3-to-S3 sync (between buckets/prefixes) would be a natural follow-up

title: Add S3 Select support for in-place querying of CSV/JSON/Parquet
description:
Implement S3 Select to let users run SQL queries on CSV, JSON, and Parquet files directly in S3 without downloading them. No desktop S3 client currently offers this -- it would be a unique selling point for Furman.

## Scope
- Query UI: SQL editor with syntax highlighting for writing SELECT queries
- Input format configuration: CSV (delimiter, header row, comments), JSON (document vs. lines), Parquet
- Output format: Display results in a table view; option to export as CSV/JSON
- Compression support: GZIP, BZIP2, and uncompressed input
- Progress reporting: S3 Select provides progress events -- show bytes scanned/processed

## Backend
- New Tauri command: s3_select_object_content
- Uses SelectObjectContent API with InputSerialization, OutputSerialization, and Expression
- Stream results back to frontend via Tauri events

## Example Use Cases
- Query a 10GB CSV log file for specific error codes without downloading
- Extract specific fields from large JSON datasets
- Preview Parquet data without any local tooling

## Notes
- S3 Select has a 256KB output limit per record
- Not supported on Glacier/Deep Archive storage classes
- Works on individual objects only (not across multiple files)
- Consider offering query templates for common operations (COUNT, WHERE, LIMIT)

title: Add CloudFront distribution management
description:
Implement CloudFront CDN management as a natural extension of the existing S3 website hosting feature. Cyberduck is the only desktop client with comprehensive CloudFront support.

## Scope
- Create/delete CloudFront distributions for S3 buckets
- Configure origins, default cache behavior, and custom error responses
- Enable/disable distributions
- Cache invalidation (invalidate specific paths or entire distribution)
- Display distribution status (In Progress / Deployed)
- Generate CloudFront URLs for objects
- CNAME configuration
- Distribution access logging

## Backend
- New Tauri commands using aws-sdk-cloudfront: s3_list_distributions, s3_create_distribution, s3_get_distribution, s3_update_distribution, s3_delete_distribution, s3_create_invalidation
- New service module: src-tauri/src/cloudfront/

## Notes
- CloudFront is a separate AWS service (not S3 API) -- requires aws-sdk-cloudfront crate
- Distribution creation/updates are async (take minutes to deploy globally)
- Pairs naturally with the existing website hosting tab in S3PropertiesDialog
- Consider adding a CloudFront tab to the bucket properties dialog

title: Add S3 Object Lock support (retention and legal hold)
description:
Implement S3 Object Lock management -- a strong differentiator since only S3 Browser has full support among desktop clients. Object Lock is critical for compliance-focused users (WORM storage, SEC Rule 17a-4, HIPAA).

## Bucket-level
- Enable Object Lock at bucket creation time (cannot be added after)
- Configure default retention mode (Governance / Compliance) and period
- Display Object Lock status in bucket properties

## Object-level
- View retention mode, retain-until date, and legal hold status in object properties
- Set/update retention on individual objects
- Place/remove legal hold on objects
- Batch update retention settings for multiple selected objects

## Backend
- New Tauri commands: s3_get_object_lock_configuration, s3_put_object_lock_configuration, s3_get_object_retention, s3_put_object_retention, s3_get_object_legal_hold, s3_put_object_legal_hold
- New service functions in s3/service.rs

## Notes
- Object Lock requires versioning to be enabled
- Compliance mode retention cannot be shortened or removed by any user, including root
- Governance mode can be bypassed with s3:BypassGovernanceRetention permission
